steps.title: Show your order or letter of guardianship signed by a judge.
steps.content: Show your order or letter of guardianship signed by a judge. If you were appointed as guardian by a court, simply provide a copy of your order or letter of guardianship that the judge signed. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Show the will appointing you as guardian.
steps.content: Show the will appointing you as guardian. A will does not provide guardianship, but it is proof of the decedent’s wishes. This should only be used during the while waiting for an actual order appointing you as guardian. Some places may not accept the will alone as proof of guardianship. If that happens, you may want to consider requesting a temporary order from the court. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Provide copies of your court document.
steps.content: Provide copies of your court document. If a person or organization needs a copy of your order, provide them a copy. Do not give them your original. It is likely that you will need it more than once. Organizations that ask for copies include: Schools Daycares Medical Providers Mental Health Providers Banks Keep your guardianship status current. So long as the ward continues to need your services and the court has not released you from your appointment, you will need to maintain certain forms with the court. You can find these requirements in your state’s probate code, or sometimes in the domestic relations statutes. These requirements include: [3] X Research source Providing an annual accounting of how you managed the ward’s assets Informing the court if the ward’s needs change Undergoing periodic training and re-investigation of your background

steps.title: Show your power of attorney.
steps.content: Show your power of attorney . In some states and circumstances, a parent or court-appointed legal guardian can grant a third person rights to act as a parent for limited activities. Be sure the power of attorney (POA) is properly executed according to the laws of your state. These laws are most likely a part of the state’s probate code. Appropriate activities to designate by POA include: Enrolling a child in a particular school Obtaining medical care for the child Managing the child’s financial position

steps.title: Provide copies of your POA.
steps.content: Provide copies of your POA. If a person or organization needs a copy of your POA, provide them a copy. Do not give them your original. It is likely that you will need it more than once. Organizations that ask for copies include: Schools Daycares Medical Providers Mental Health Providers Banks

steps.title: Inform the above organizations when the POA is terminated.
steps.content: Inform the above organizations when the POA is terminated. If your POA is terminated, you should inform anyone who has been relying upon it that you are no longer the appropriate point of contact. This may mean that you also no longer have the right to receive any of the information regarding those issues. In general, POAs terminate by: [4] X Research source Death of the principal or agent Incapacity of the principal or agent Revocation by the principal By the terms of the POA The purpose of the POA has been fulfilled

steps.title: Show your affidavit of guardianship.
steps.content: Show your affidavit of guardianship. If the parent(s) appointed you as guardian for a short period of time, they may have executed an affidavit of guardianship. This document should clearly spell out the effective time period and the types of things the temporary guardian may and may not do. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Provide copies of your affidavit.
steps.content: Provide copies of your affidavit. If a person or organization needs a copy of your affidavit, provide them a copy. Do not give them your original. It is likely that you will need it more than once. Organizations that ask for copies include: Schools Daycares Medical Providers Mental Health Providers Banks

steps.title: Act as a guardian.
steps.content: Act as a guardian. During the effective period of the affidavit, you will need to conduct yourself as the substitute parent. Unless specifically prohibited by the guardianship affidavit, you will do such tasks as: [6] X Research source Make immediate medical decisions for your ward Be responsible for accessing and providing daily care for the ward Be responsible for accessing any necessary educational facilities for the ward
